title: TISVA Opens a New Micro Credit Center in Turkey with the Support of Citi Turkey and Citi Foundation
summary: Antalya, Turkey - TISVA (Turkish Foundation for Waste Reduction) has opened a new micro credit center in the city of Antalya with the support of Citi Turkey and the Citi Foundation. Since 2007, TISVA has been collaborating with Citi Turkey and the Citi Foundation, in line with the organization's mission to extend the program to all cities across the country. The micro credit centers aim to provide capacity-building training and micro loans to women's groups in order to achieve Citi Foundation's commitment to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of low-income individuals.
tag-1: TISVA Opens a New Micro Credit Center in Turkey with the Support of Citi Turkey and Citi Foundation
tag-3: Antalya, Turkey – TISVA (Turkish Foundation for Waste Reduction) has opened a new micro credit center in the city of Antalya with the support of Citi Turkey and the Citi Foundation. Since 2007, TISVA has been collaborating with Citi Turkey and the Citi Foundation, in line with the organization's mission to extend the program to all cities across the country. The micro credit centers aim to provide capacity-building training and micro loans to women's groups in order to achieve Citi Foundation's commitment to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of low-income individuals.
tag-4: Abdulkadir Aksu, Former Minister of the Interior of Turkey Republic; Dr. Ahmet Altiparmak, Governor of Antalya; Aziz Akgul, Chairman, TISVA; Erkan Sever, Board Member, Citi Turkey and micro entrepreneur women in Antalya attended the official opening ceremony of Antalya micro credit center.
tag-5: Erkan Sever, Board Member, Citi Turkey, said: "As Citibank, we would like to contribute to the communities we live in. We have been working in collaboration with NGOs since 1997 through supporting new projects and volunteerism with our employees. We believe working on projects in which we specialize is the best way to contribute to the communities. In line with that, we are very active in supporting micro entrepreneurship projects in Turkey. Since 2007, we have collaborated with TISVA, led by Aziz Akgul, and would like to continue supporting the opening of new micro credit centers in other cities throughout Turkey with the support of the Citi Foundation.
tag-6: "Today, we come together to announce the next step in our cooperation. Following the micro credit centers in Batman, Ordu and Mus, Antalya micro credit center is the fourth center TISVA opens with the support of Citi Turkey and Citi Foundation. We believe Antalya micro credit center will support micro entrepreneur women in Antalya who would like to establish and run their own businesses. I would like to thank Aziz Akgul, the leader of the project and the women entrepreneurs who never give up."
tag-7: Commenting on the new micro credit center, Aziz Akgul, Chairman, TISVA, said: "Micro credit is a very valuable tool that enables low-income women to gain economic empowerment so that they can improve their standard of living. I would like to thank Citi Turkey and Citi Foundation who supported TISVA in extending the program throughout Turkey."
tag-8: Under the Turkey Grameen Microcredit Project, TISVA has been providing capacity-building training and micro loans to micro entrepreneur women in Turkey since 2003. Antalya micro credit center is the fourth center TISVA has opened with the support of Citi Turkey and the Citi Foundation. With the new micro credit center, TISVA reaches 75 micro credit centers in 60 provinces throughout Turkey. TISVA has more than 51,000 members in Turkey and has provided 116 million TL in micro loans since 2003. TISVA has received 90 million TL back with a 100 percent repayment rate.
